subject: Re: [junit] Unit testing XML generation
msgSnippet: depends on the kind of granularity that your test would involve. If the xml differs, a tool like ibm s xml diff ( i haven t use it..) would help..although that
messageBody:
depends on the kind of granularity that your test would involve.
If the xml differs, a tool like ibm's xml diff ( i haven't use it..) would
help..although that would be additional complexity.
Else , using a tool like castor (www.exolab.org) to unmarshal and compare
objects would be neater.

ciao

----- Original Message -----
From: "Magnus ?or Torfason" <magnus@...>
To: <junit@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Friday, January 11, 2002 4:35 PM
Subject: [junit] Unit testing XML generation


> I have an XML generation process that I use to convert internal
> datastructures to XML. I want this process to be Unit tested, to ensure
> that the generated XML matches the template XML that I have defined.
>
> My problem is that the only way to compare the two files in a simple way
is
> to do a string compare. This is not acceptable, since I am not interested
> in string equality (encoding and linefeed may very well differ) but in XML
> equality (that both documents have exactly the same elements and
> attributes).
>
> Does anyone know of a way to compare two XML files so that only the XML
> semantics are compared, not the underlying strings?
>
> Thanks and regards,
>
> Magnus Torfason
>
